get.summary: Gets the users recent activities

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to retreive. Default 10, max 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset to start from. Default 0.

delete.summary:
Deletes a single unthreaded anchor for a document
If you need to delete a threaded anchor, see the delete comment handler

patch.summary: Edits a single anchor for a document

post.summary:
Creates an unthreaded anchor for a document
If you need to create a threaded anchor, see the create comment handler

get.summary: Gets a set of comment anchors for a document

delete.summary: Deletes a single comment for a document

patch.summary: Edits a single comment for a document

post.summary:
Creates a single comment for a document
Optionally creates a new thread/anchor if one does not exist

get.summary: Gets a set of comment threads for a document
Gets the users documents to populate their recent document list

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of documents to retreive. Default 10, max 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset to start from. Default 0.

parameters.name: file_type
parameters.description: The file type to filter by. Default all.

contentType.description: Content type of the document converted from file type

fileType.description: The file type of the document

post.summary: Creates a new blank docx file for the user

get.summary: Gets a list of all the user's documents so they are able to be searched on

post.summary: Validates the provided document permissions token
Generates a document permissions token for a provided document id

put.summary:
Takes the docx document bom parts and generates presigned urls to upload
any new content

get.summary: Gets a particular document by its id

put.summary: Creates a new version of a document

delete.summary:
Deletes a specific document.
The document will be soft deleted and appear in the user's trash for 30 days.

post.summary:
Handles copying a given document. This is the similar to
create_document_handler where you provide the branched_from_id,
branched_from_version_id and document_family_id in the request body. Except
this will not require you to re-upload the document when it's made saving
time and resources.

parameters.name: version_id
parameters.description: The version id of the document to copy. Defaults to copying the latest version of the document.

get.summary:
Generates a presigned url to download the raw content of the document
For files with modification layers, they will not be applied in the downloaded file.
Gets the presigned url(s) for the document. aka location

parameters.name: document_version_id
parameters.description: A specific document version id to get the location for.

parameters.name: get_converted_docx_url
parameters.description: If true, this will return the converted docx url.

get.summary: Fetches the document pdf processing result for a given document id
Fetches the document processing result for a given document id and job id

put.summary:
For any file that isn't PDF or DOCX, use this endpoint for saving.
This endpoint will allow you to save the document by providing the file content as part of a multipart request. Use key 'file' along with the file bytes.
simple_save is different than the save_document endpoint because it does not return a presigned URL, Instead, it simply saves the file to S3 directly (and returns the document metadata).

get.summary: Gets the list of users who have viewed a given document
Gets a particular document by its id
Health check
Gets the users history

post.summary: Upserts an item into the user's history and performs other necessary tracking actions

delete.summary: Deletes an item from the user's history

get.summary: Gets the instructions document for the current user

404.description: User does not have an instructions document

post.summary: Creates an instructions document for the current user

get.summary: Gets the items the user has access to

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Whether to expand projects. Defaults to true.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of items returned. Defaults to 20. Max 500.

parameters.name: sort_method
parameters.description: Sort method. Options are viewed_at, created_at, updated_at, viewed_updated. Defaults to viewed_at.

post.summary: Gets the items the user has access to

get.summary: Gets the users pinned items

patch.summary: Saves the updated order of the pins for the user

post.summary: Pins the item for the user

delete.summary: Deletes the pin for the user

get.summary: Gets all the users projects. This includes projects shared with the user.

post.summary:
Creates a new project.
The project can be created as a sub-project of another project or as a top-level project.

get.summary: Gets all the users projects that are pending upload. This includes projects shared with the user.

post.summary:
Uploads a folder to the user's cloud storage. Mimicing the folder structure
with projects and placing all documents in the correct location.

destinationMap.description: maps document id to presigned url (external) or s3 info (internal)

fileSystem.description: file system with project ids and document ids

post.summary:
Creates a request id in the dynamodb table for tracking the upload
Returns a presigned url for uploading a zip file to the staging bucket
Returns a request id for tracking the upload

delete.summary:
Deletes a project.
Soft deletes the project and all of its children.

chat_ids.description: The ids of the chats that were marked as deleted

document_ids.description: The ids of the documents that were marked as deleted

project_ids.description: The ids of the project that were marked as deleted

delete.summary: Permanently deletes a project and all of it's children.

ChannelFilters.description: The channel message filters used to filter down what channel messages you search over.

channel_ids.description: Channel IDs to search within. Examples: ['general']. Empty to search all accessible channels.

mentions.description: Channel user mentions to search for. Examples: ['@username']. Empty if not filtering by mentions.

org_id.description: Channel organization ID to search within. Empty to ignore organization filtering.

sender_ids.description: Sender IDs to search within. Examples: ['user1']. Empty to search all accessible senders.

thread_ids.description: Channel thread IDs to search within. Examples: ['thread123']. Empty to search all threads.

access_level.description: The access level for the channel

createdAt.description: The time the chat was created

deletedAt.description: The time the chat was deleted

model.description: The model used to generate the chat

projectId.description: The project id of the chat

updatedAt.description: The time the chat was last updated

ChatFilters.description: The chat filters used to filter down what chats you search over.

chat_ids.description: Chat ids to search over. Examples: ['chat1'], ['chat1', 'chat2']. When provided, chat search will only match results on these chats. Empty to search all accessible chats.

owners.description: Filter by chat owner. Examples: ['macro|user1@user.com'], ['macro|user1@user.com', 'macro|user2@user.com']. Empty to search all owners.

project_ids.description: A list of project ids to search within. Examples: ['project1']. Empty to ignore project filtering.

role.description: Chat message roles to search. Examples: ['user'], ['assistant']. Empty to search all roles.

version_id.description: The version id of the document to copy. Defaults to copying the latest version of the document.

documentName.description: The name of the document without extension.

oneOf.description:
The created documents metadata
Only returned if the document was created successfully

The presigned url used to upload the document
Only returned if the document was created successfully

success.description: Indicates if the document was created successfully

branchedFromId.description: The document id if the document is being branched.

branchedFromVersionId.description: The version id if the document is being branched.

createdAt.description: Optional time to set the document's created_at to. Set when backfilling email attachments.

documentFamilyId.description: The document family id if the document is being branched.

documentName.description: The name of the document without extension.

emailAttachmentId.description:
Internal only field that links the document created to the specified email attachment by
creating a row in the document_email table.

fileType.description: Optional file type of the document.

id.description: The id of the document in the database

jobId.description:
Optional job id to be used to track an upload job for the newly created document.
Will need to have a corresponding job initiated for the file beforehand.

mimeType.description: The content type of the document (currently only used for logging matches against file type).

contentType.description: Content type of the document converted from file type

fileType.description: The file type of the document

projectParentId.description: The project that the new project will belong to.

DocumentFilters.description: The document filters used to filter down what documents you search over.

document_ids.description: Document ids to search over. Examples: ['doc1'], ['doc1', 'doc2']. Empty to search all accessible documents.

file_types.description: Document file types to search. Examples: ['pdf'], ['md', 'txt']. Empty to search all file types.

owners.description: Filter by document owner. Examples: ['macro|user1@user.com'], ['macro|user1@user.com', 'macro|user2@user.com']. Empty to search all owners.

project_ids.description:
A list of project ids to search within. Examples: ['project1'].
filtering. Empty to ignore project filtering.

EmailFilters.description: The email filters used to filter down what emails you search over.

bcc.description: Email BCC addresses to filter by. Examples: ['user@example.com']. Empty if not filtering by BCC.

cc.description: Email CC addresses to filter by. Examples: ['user@example.com']. Empty if not filtering by CC.

recipients.description: Email Recipient addresses to filter by. Examples: ['user@example.com']. Empty if not filtering by Recipient.

senders.description: Email sender addresses to filter by. Examples: ['user@example.com']. Empty to search all senders.

EmptyResponse.description: Empty response is required due to custom fetch forcing `response.json()`

EntityFilters.description: a bundle of all of the filters for each entity type

ErrorResponse.description:
A plain old json error response for use with axum.
yup, thats it.

ExcludedDefaultView.description:
Frontend can define any set of its own default views for the user.
This is a list of views that are excluded from the default views list on the frontend.

It is important that the frontend can quickly iterate on default views, for that reason
we don't keep track of default views in the database, only those that are explicitly excluded.

presigned_url.description: The presigned url to download the raw content of the document

FileType.description:
Generates a FileType enum and associated ContentType enum with their implementations.

This macro takes a list of tuples in the format:
(Variant, "extension", "mime_type", CONTENT_TYPE_VARIANT)

For each tuple it generates:
- A variant in the FileType enum
- A variant in the ContentType enum
- Implementations for:
  - FileType::to_str() - Converts FileType to extension string
  - FileType::from_str() - Converts extension string to FileType
  - From<FileType> for ContentType - Maps FileType to ContentType
  - ContentType::mime_type() - Gets MIME type for ContentType

oneOf.description: The file type of the file

fullName.description: The full OS name of the file for deduplication

name.description: The name of the file, without the extension

relativePath.description:
The relative path of the file.

This is the `webkitRelativePath` with the name of the file stripped at the end.

config.description:
It is an explicit choice that the structure of the view configuration
is up to the frontend. The structure and composition of view configuration
is still very much in flux.
